title: Multi-Agent System Optimization Consensus Tracking: Control Learning and Natural Language Interaction Optimization Based on Linguistic Processing Data

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in the relevant field or equivalent experience. Foundational knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) (morphological analysis, syntactic parsing, semantic interpretation) and control systems theory. Experience in text-based command processing and multilingual system design
context.additional_context: An advanced course for engineers responsible for optimizing corporate language processing systems, emphasizing practical learning through real-world industrial applications. Includes case studies on voice/text-based control command interpretation, multilingual system integration, and language model-control system linkages. Analyzes context-based command interpretation and multilingual support system design considering cultural differences.

learning_goals: Definition of tracking error dynamics in multi-agent systems and establishment of optimization strategies for language processing systems through game-theoretic modeling. Strengthening syntactic parsing and semantic interpretation capabilities of text-based control commands

Learners can design one industrial robot control algorithm using a data-driven error estimator (e.g., Kalman filter) within one week and submit implementation results achieving over 90% simulation accuracy in MATLAB/Simulink. Notably, integration of an NLP-based control command interpretation module optimizes language-machine interaction and ensures multilingual command processing capabilities

Cultivation of proficiency in distributed optimization control methods combining I/O Q-learning and least squares methods. Efficient processing of text-based control commands and design of multilingual support systems. Enhancement of context-dependent language expression processing and lexical ambiguity resolution skills

Establishment of control laws enabling optimal consensus tracking without model information. Strengthening probabilistic modeling for language ambiguity resolution and multi-interpretation processing capabilities. Real-time conversion and control system integration of voice/text commands
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
